title: 114_hr584
content: The Act may be cited as the "End Pensions in Congress Act" or the "EPIC Act." Amendments relating to the Civil Service Retirement System are included. The "End Pensions in Congress Act" or the "EPIC Act" amends the Civil Service Retirement System by terminating further retirement coverage of Members of Congress. This means that Members will no longer be subject to this subchapter for any future period, and no more Government contributions or deductions from basic pay will be made for them. The "End Pensions in Congress Act" terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress, removing entitlements and benefits under this subchapter. Participation in the Thrift Savings Plan is unaffected. Regulations for implementation may be prescribed by relevant authorities. The Vice President is excluded from the definition of "Member." Members have the option to opt-in within 90 days of enactment. Members of Congress covered by the "End Pensions in Congress Act" have the option to remain subject to retirement coverage within 90 days of enactment by giving written notice. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress under the Federal Employees Retirement System. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress under the Federal Employees Retirement System by inserting a new section after section 8425 in title 5, United States Code. Members who first joined before the enactment date will no longer be covered by this chapter, with no further contributions or deductions allowed. The new section in title 5, United States Code terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress under the Federal Employees Retirement System. Members who joined before the enactment date will no longer be subject to this chapter, with no Government contributions or deductions allowed. This does not affect any rights or benefits prior to the enactment date and does not impact eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan. The regulations necessary for implementing the termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress under the Federal Employees Retirement System may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management or the Executive Director for matters related to the Thrift Savings Plan. Refunds will be provided for Members with less than 5 years of civilian service at the enactment date. The lump-sum credit for Members of Congress under the Federal Employees Retirement System is payable upon enactment, excluding the Vice President. Members can opt-in to remain under this chapter within 90 days. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress.
